Core.Tree

Class NAryTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • Core.Tree.NAryTree

  • public class NAryTree
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an N-ary tree structure where each node can have zero or more children. Provides utilities for common tree operations such as insertion, deletion, searching, traversals, and structural properties (height, cardinality, degree, etc.).

    This implementation supports:

    • Pre-order, in-order, post-order, and per-level traversals.
    • Insertion of new nodes under a given parent.
    • Searching for nodes by value.
    • Deletion of nodes by value.
    • Calculation of tree properties such as height, cardinality, degree, and leaf count.

    All tree nodes are instances of NAryNode.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      NAryNode root
      The root node of the N-ary tree.

      Constructor and Description
      NAryTree()
      Creates an empty N-ary tree.
      NAryTree(NAryNode root)
      Creates a new N-ary tree with the given root.

      void addNode(NAryNode parent, int data)

      Deletes a node with the given value from the tree.
      void getAmountOfLeafs()
      Prints the number of leaf nodes (nodes without children) in the tree.
      void getCardinality()
      Prints the number of nodes in the tree (cardinality).
      void getGrade()
      Prints the maximum degree of the tree (the highest number of children of any node).

      Prints the height of the tree.

      Performs an in-order traversal of the tree and prints the nodes.
      void perLevelsTraversal()
      Prints the nodes of the tree level by level.

      Performs a post-order traversal of the tree and prints the nodes.

      Performs a pre-order traversal of the tree and prints the nodes.

    • Field Detail

      • root

        public NAryNode root
        The root node of the N-ary tree.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NAryTree

        public NAryTree()
        Creates an empty N-ary tree.

      • NAryTree

        public NAryTree(NAryNode root)
        Creates a new N-ary tree with the given root.
        Parameters:
        root - the root node of the tree

    • Method Detail

      • getHeight

        public void getHeight()
        Prints the height of the tree. The height of an empty tree is 0.

      • preOrderTraversal

        public void preOrderTraversal()
        Performs a pre-order traversal of the tree and prints the nodes.

      • inOrderTraversal

        public void inOrderTraversal()
        Performs an in-order traversal of the tree and prints the nodes. In the context of N-ary trees, this prints half the children before the node and half after.

      • postOrderTraversal

        public void postOrderTraversal()
        Performs a post-order traversal of the tree and prints the nodes.

      • perLevelsTraversal

        public void perLevelsTraversal()
        Prints the nodes of the tree level by level.

      • printGivenLevel

        public void printGivenLevel(NAryNode root,
                            int level,
                            int height)
        Prints all nodes at a given level of the N-ary tree.

        If the level does not exist, an error message is printed instead.

        Parameters:
        root - the root node of the N-ary tree or subtree.
        level - the level to print (0 = root).
        height - the height of the tree used to validate the requested level.

      • addNode

        public void addNode(NAryNode parent,
                    int data)
        Adds a new node with the given data as a child of the specified parent. If the tree is empty, the new node becomes the root.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent node under which the new node will be added
        data - the value for the new node

      • searchNode

        public void searchNode(int data)
        Searches for a node by its value and prints whether it exists.
        Parameters:
        data - the value to search for

      • deleteNode

        public void deleteNode(NAryNode parent,
                       int data,
                       boolean replaceWithChild)
        Deletes a node with the given value from the tree. If the root matches the value, the tree becomes empty.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent of the node to delete (can be null if deleting root)
        data - the value of the node to delete
        replaceWithChild - unused parameter placeholder for future logic

      • getCardinality

        public void getCardinality()
        Prints the number of nodes in the tree (cardinality).

      • getGrade

        public void getGrade()
        Prints the maximum degree of the tree (the highest number of children of any node).

      • getAmountOfLeafs

        public void getAmountOfLeafs()
        Prints the number of leaf nodes (nodes without children) in the tree.
